body: I think we should stop the command immediately and show the error that a file or directory with that name already exists and that we cannot proceed further

The same issue occurs even with helm v3

`version.BuildInfo{Version:"v3.0.1", GitCommit:"7c22ef9ce89e0ebeb7125ba2ebf7d421f3e82ffa", GitTreeState:"clean", GoVersion:"go1.13.4"}`

We can mark this as both v2 and v3 issue. 

I also see this as a bad UX as the error that shows up is not clear as to what's the problem when there's already a file in that name. 

And the latter - existing directory with same name, it's problematic as it's possible that user might not be aware that there's already a directory in that name and it's all getting merged. One such example is when let's say I'm trying out multiple versions of the same chart using untar 

```
$ helm fetch stable/redis --untar
$ ls redis
Chart.yaml              ci                      values-production.yaml  values.yaml
README.md               templates               values.schema.json
$ cat redis/Chart.yaml
...
...
version: 10.2.1
$ helm fetch stable/redis --untar --version 10.2.0
$ # same redis directory gets modified because of the merge
$ ls redis
Chart.yaml              ci                      values-production.yaml  values.yaml
README.md               templates               values.schema.json
$ cat redis/Chart.yaml
...
...
version: 10.2.0
```
I agree that we should stop with an error immediately if a file or directory with that name already exists. Does someone want to create a PR for this?
@mattfarina Hi, I would like to take the chance to create a PR for this. üòÅ

issue.title: stop with an error immediately if a file or directory with that name already exists

issue.body:
fix #7182

If the path already exited, no matter it is a file or directory, stop with an error immediately.

body: @zwwhdls I see you raised a PR against `master` branch for Helm v3, could you also raise a PR for Helm v2 in `dev-v2` branch? üòÑ
@karuppiah7890 of course! I'd like to do this!
